description: A French MP wants to push back against the traditional Parisian disdain for regional voices.
title: Why France may ban discrimination against accents
title_page: Why France may ban discrimination against accents - BBC News
maintext: France cannot boast quite the same diversity of accents as the UK. Centralisers from the Revolution on did their best to suppress regional languages first - like Occitan and Breton - then the accents that emerged from them. Schools were the first instrument of conformity, then mass media.
